text:
Hi,

Tomcat 6 is not running as a service on vista. When I tried to start the service thru tomcat6w.exe it didn’t started.

Tomcat was installed in C:/Program Files/Apache Software Foundation/Tomcat 6.0. 
 

I read on some blogs that it will work if tomcat is installed on D or any drive other than C, but didn’t verify as vista machine is not available currently.

 

Below are the error logs in tomcat logs:
 

[2009-05-21 18:24:12] [info] Procrun (2.0.4.0) started
[2009-05-21 18:24:12] [info] Running Service...
[2009-05-21 18:24:12] [info] Starting service...
[2009-05-21 18:24:12] [174  javajni.c] [error] The specified module could not be found.
[2009-05-21 18:24:12] [994  prunsrv.c] [error] Failed creating java C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\client\jvm.dll
[2009-05-21 18:24:12] [1269 prunsrv.c] [error] ServiceStart returned 1
[2009-05-21 18:24:12] [info] Run service finished.
[2009-05-21 18:24:12] [info] Procrun finished.

Kindly let me know whether it’s a known defect or is another configuration issue.

I know it might not be a bug but still enetring this problem as bug as the e-mail to dev@tomcat.apache.org does not delivers even after registration.

Thanks

Abhishek
creator: asharma3@safenet-inc.com

text: That is a question for the users list. If you have problems posting to that list, contact users-owner@...
creator: markt@apache.org
